required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: EFFECT OF ANESTHESİA TECHNIQUES ON POSTOPERATİVE COGNİTİVE DYSFUNCTION FOR MMSE AND NSE LEVEL
clinical_study.official_title: THE EFFECT OF TOTAL INTRAVENOUS ANESTHESIA AND INHALATION ANESTHESIA TECHNIQUES FOR MINI MENTAL STATE EXAMINATION TEST AND NEURON SPECIFIC ENOLASE LEVEL IN LUMBAR DISK HERNIECTOMY OPERATIONS

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the effects of total intravenous anesthesia and inhalation anesthesia methods on postoperative cognitive dysfunction according to Mini Mental State Examination scores and Neuron Specific Enolase levels in lumbar disc herniectomy operations.

primary_outcome.description: BELOW 27 SCORE IS ASSOSIATED WITH POSTOPERATIVE COGNITIVE DYSFUNCTION

intervention.description: NEURON SPECIFIC ENOLASE LEVELS IN LUMBAR DISC HERNIECTOMY WITH GENERAL ANESTHESIA MODALITIES

study_pop.textblock: Lumbal disc herniectomy operation is planned for ASA I, II and III risk group between the ages of 18-65.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Lumbal disc herniectomy operation 18-65 age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients before and after the coronary artery bypass graft surgery
- patients in the last trimester of pregnancy
- patients with severe heart failure
- liver failure
- kidney failure
- malignant hyperthermia
- lactating patients
- patients with vision or hearing problems
- patients having difficulty in understanding and speaking Turkish
- Parkinson's and Alzheimer's disease
- alcohol and drug addicts
- morbidly obese patients
- intraoperative hypotension, hypertension and hypoxemia

results_reference.citation: Goswami U, Babbar S, Tiwari S.
